Function Documentation

char* mystrcat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Appends the src string to the dest string over-writing the '/0' character at the end of dest, then adds a '/0' back on to the end of the resulting string. dest string must have ebough space for result.

Parameters:
dest Pointer to the first string of the concatenation, which becomes the result afterwards
src Pointer to the string to be added onto the end of dest
Returns:
dest Pointer to the concatenated string

char* mystrcpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Copies the array pointed by src into the array pointed by destination (including the null ending character

Parameters:
src Pointer to the string to be copied
dest Pointer to the new copy of the string
Returns:
start_of_dest Pointer to the string copy

char* mystrdup ( const char *  src  ) 

Duplicates a C-style string.

Parameters:
src Pointer to string to be copied
Returns:
Pointer to freshly-allocated string containing a duplicate of src or null if no memory is available

Calculates the length of a string

Returns:
the length of the string (int)

char* mystrncat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Appends the first n characters, plus a '/0' character from src onto the end of dest, overwriting the '/0' of dest.

Parameters:
dest Pointer to the first string of concatenation, which becomes the result afterwards
src Pointer to the string to be added onto the end of dest
n the amount of characters from src to concatenate onto dest
Returns:
dest Pointer to the concatenated string

char* mystrncpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Copies the first n bytes of src. If there is no null bytes among the first n bytes of src, result will not be null-terminated. If length of src is less than n, remainder of dest will be null-padded.

Parameters:
dest Pointer to the string copy
src Pointer to the string to be copied
n number of bytes to be copied
Returns:
start_of_dest Pointer to the string copy

char* mystrndup ( const char *  s,
size_t  n 
)

Duplicates a C-style string up to n characters. If s is longer than n, only n characters are copied, and a '/0' is added. malloc() and free() are used to obtain memory for the new string.

Parameters:
s Pointer to the string to be duplicated
n the number of characters to be duplicated from s
Returns:
Pointer to the string duplicate
